ticket.title: ActionView::TestCase returns 'No route' error while creating a link with a link_to
ticket.original-body: Hello! I want to have a partial rendering a link to current page but with different parameters. In order to do that I created a link like this: <%= link_to 'something', params.merge({:fare_class_type => 'economy'}) %> And it works fine in rails. This helper generates a code like this. something But when I'm trying to render a partial using such helper with rspec, I catch No route matches {:fare_class_type=>"economy"} I'm not sure that it's a bug of rspec, but It would be great to hear any advices about what to do.
ticket.latest-body: Hello! I want to have a partial rendering a link to current page but with different parameters. In order to do that I created a link like this: <%= link_to 'something', params.merge({:fare_class_type => 'economy'}) %> And it works fine in rails. This helper generates a code like this. something But when I'm trying to render a partial using such helper with rspec, I catch No route matches {:fare_class_type=>"economy"} I'm not sure that it's a bug of rspec, but It would be great to hear any advices about what to do.
ticket.original-body-html:
Hello!

I want to have a partial rendering a link to current page but with different parameters. In order to do that I created a link like this:

<%= link_to 'something', params.merge({:fare_class_type => 'economy'}) %>

And it works fine in rails. This helper generates a code like this.

<a href="/admin/agencies?fare_class_type=economy">something</a>

But when I'm trying to render a partial using such helper with rspec, I catch

No route matches {:fare_class_type=>"economy"}

I'm not sure that it's a bug of rspec, but It would be great to hear any advices about what to do.

version.body: Hello! I want to have a partial rendering a link to current page but with different parameters. version.body:
Sorry, using rails from github:
gem 'rails', :git => 'git://github.com/rails/rails.git', :ref => "b7c4523a94c8cbd13f18"

version.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not been commented on for at least three months.
The resources of the Rails core team are limited, and so we are asking for your help. If you can still reproduce this error on the 3-0-stable branch or on master, please reply with all of the information you have about it and add "[state:open]" to your comment. This will reopen the ticket for review. Likewise, if you feel that this is a very important feature for Rails to include, please reply with your explanation so we can consider it.
Thank you for all your contributions, and we hope you will understand this step to focus our efforts where they are most helpful.

This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not been commented on for at least three months.

The resources of the Rails core team are limited, and so we are asking for your help. If you can still reproduce this error on the 3-0-stable branch or on master, please reply with all of the information you have about it and add "[state:open]" to your comment. This will reopen the ticket for review. Likewise, if you feel that this is a very important feature for Rails to include, please reply with your explanation so we can consider it.

Thank you for all your contributions, and we hope you will understand this step to focus our efforts where they are most helpful.
